references.paper_title: Learning transferable visual models from natural language supervision
references.reason: This paper introduces CLIP, a foundational model for aligning text and image representations, which is crucial to many text-to-image diffusion models and safety techniques.

references.paper_title: High-resolution image synthesis with latent diffusion models
references.reason: This paper introduces Stable Diffusion, a widely-used and influential diffusion model architecture that forms the basis for many of the models discussed in the paper.
This paper directly addresses the problem of removing harmful concepts from diffusion models, which is the core focus of the target paper.

references.paper_title: Hierarchical text-conditional image generation with clip latents
references.reason: This paper details DALL-E 2, a highly influential text-to-image model that uses CLIP for text-image alignment, impacting the field and methods for safety.

references.paper_title: Safe latent diffusion: Mitigating inappropriate degeneration in diffusion models
references.reason: This paper presents another important approach to building safer diffusion models, offering a comparative method to the approach of the target paper.
